contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox artist | bgcolour = #6495ED | name = W. Herbert "Buck" Dunton | image = Taos Society of Artists founders.jpg | imagesize = 240px | caption = Buck Dunton, third from left,<br>with Taos Society of Artists founding members | birth_name = | birth_date = {{birth date |1878|8|28|}} | birth_place = [[Augusta, Maine]] | death_date = {{death date |1936|3|18|}} | death_place = [[Taos, New Mexico]] | nationality = [[United States|American]] | field = [[Painting]] | training = | movement = [[Taos Society of Artists]] | works = | patrons = | influenced by = | influenced = | awards = }} '''William Herbert "Buck" Dunton''' (28 August 1878 – 18 March 1936) was an [[United States|American]] artist and a founding member of the [[Taos Society of Artists]]. He is noted for paintings of [[Native Americans in the United States|Native Americans]], [[New Mexico]], and the [[Southwestern United States|American Southwest]]. ==Early life and education== [[File:William Herbert Dunton - The horse rustler.jpg|thumb|right|240px|W. Herbert "Buck" Dunton, ''The Horse Rustler,'' ca. 1915]] Dunton worked as a [[ranch]] hand as a youth and studied at the [[Cowles Art School]] in [[Boston]], [[Massachusetts]]. ==Artistic career== He first visited Taos in 1912 and became part of the [[Taos art colony]]. Dunton became one of the founding members of the [[Taos Society of Artists]] in 1915. Among his proteges in [[Western (genre)|Western]] art was [[Harold Dow Bugbee]] of [[Clarendon, Texas|Clarendon]] and [[Canyon, Texas|Canyon]] in the [[Texas Panhandle]]. In 1921, American oil executive [[W. H. McFadden]] commissioned Dunton to paint a full-length portrait of big-game hunter [[Ben Lilly]]. The portrait was exhibited by the [[National Academy of Design]] before being located in McFadden’s home in New Orleans.<ref>Dobbie, J. Frank. 1997. The Ben Lilly Legend. 5th printing. Publisher: University Of Texas Press, TX, USA. ISBN 0-292-70728-2</ref> ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== {{Portal|Biography}} * {{Find a Grave|8153929}} *[http://www.askart.com/askart/d/buck_dunton/buck_dunton.aspx AskArt: ''William Herbert Dunton'', Biography] *[http://www.africahunting.com/hunting-pictures-videos/showphoto.php?photo=7146&title=benjamin-vernon-lilly&cat=500 Africa Hunting: Painting of Ben Lilly by Herbert Dunton] {{Authority control|VIAF=26005772}} {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]] --> | NAME =Dunton, W.
